projects.title: Michigan Tech Camera Experience
projects.description: A combination of all of the Michigan Technological University cameras into one ambient homepage. This project was made to prove the point that 'Nature is Media, and Media is Nature' during a class project.
projects.note: Developed using Python, OpenCV, and ExpressJS

projects.title: Jellyboard
projects.description: An application that improves an educator's ability to gauge student feedback and understanding within a classroom. This webapp is based off of the late Google Jamboard, but allows for multiple types of user input with a quick start-up time.
projects.note: This application was developed in collaboration with the University of Michigan's HackDearborn event. Developed using VueJS, ExpressJS, and MongoDB

projects.title: Quill
projects.description: A recreation of Aequitas Solution's Q application for the Plymouth Canton Community Schools district. I worked with WayneRESA to recieve testing data and the current version of the Q application to create a interactive and easy-to-use interface for the benefit of students, teachers, and parents around the district.
projects.note: The source code for this project cannot be shared for copyright reasons. Developed using VueJS, Python, ExpressJS, and SQL

projects.title: StormCloud
projects.description: A FIRST Robotics Competition scouting application with fully customizable data collection forms and analysis. This application was made for FRC Team 862: Lightning Robotics to use during the 2023 FIRST Robotics Competition season

projects.title: Robofest Timer
projects.description: An interactive timer built for the Robofest GAME competition, with advising from the Robofest Founder, Dr. CJ Chung. This timer, along with several other scoring system prototypes have been used at various competitions across the past few years, including the 2023 Robofest World Championship.

projects.title: PolarHab
projects.description: An informational and interactive website to teach students about the Canadian Polar Bear Habitat and the importance of conservation. The website leads participants through various activites, quizzes, and videos to eventually give them a certificate of completion!
projects.note: Submission for KuriusHacks SE20. Developed using NodeJS, .NET Blazor, and C#.

projects.title: Ribbon Runner
projects.description: A virtual walking application to encourage support for the Breast Cancer Society of Canada. In the midst of COVID-19, this app would track individual workout statistics and combine them with other team members to allow people to compete from the comfort of their own bubbles.
projects.note: Winner of the Breast Cancer Society of Canada Challenge in KuriusHacks SE21. Developed using NodeJS, .NET Xamarin, and C#.

projects.title: The7GatesArchive
projects.description: An online leaderboard for the Game Theory ARG, where player statistics, insights, and individual gate times could be seen. This was one of the first major development projects that I made, and there are many improvements that should've been made to it.
projects.note: The image shown is not the actual website, but the website that the project was based off of. Makes use of the CreatorINK API. Developed using .NET Blazor, C#, and SQL.
